page.title: 13WALKING IN CRESSBROOK DALE
page.content: WALKS.Cressbrook Dale.Take the tarmac road northwards from Cressbrook and follow the sign to Ravensdale Cottages To the right is a Nature Reserve,and above, spectacular limestone rocks.The rough, stony path leads through the woods with dog mercury ground cover denoting ancient woodland. From here the Cressbrook is dry from May to October. On the left is steep pasture covered with dog daisies, clover and cats'ears. After crossing the bridge, sunlit pasture on the right has a profusion of wild flowers. eg.bloody crane's bill, orchids, herb-robert, yarrow, knap weed, buttercups, briar roses and hazels. The path rises steeply almost to the top of the valley and opens out into rough hill pasture with outcropping limestone. There are signs of former lead mining. Turn right to Wardlow,left to Litton.
